columns.text: In this exercise, we are to provide the proforma statements and determine the amount of the plug variable.

## Pro Forma Statements
\
Pro Forma statements include a forecasted balance sheet, an income statement, and a statement of cash flows. These financial statements are necessary for the determination of the summary of projected events in the succeeding years of operation of the firm.
\
The pro forma statements are considered outputs of the financial plan. The management would estimate the projected and would then produce the pro forma statements.

Now, let us determine the plug variable using the following given:
 

<center>

|Given||
|:--|--:|
|Income Statement||
|$\hspace{20pt}$Sales|\$38,000|
|$\hspace{20pt}$Cost|\$32,600|
|$\hspace{20pt}$Net Income|\$5,400|
|Balance Sheet||
|$\hspace{20pt}$Assets|\$27,300|
|$\hspace{20pt}$Debt|\$6,700|
|$\hspace{20pt}$Equity|\$20,600|

Now, let us prepare the pro forma income statement:
 
$$\textbf{Pro Forma}\\
\textbf{Income Statement}$$

$$\begin{array}{l r}
\text{Sales}&{\$43,700}\\
\text{Cost}&\underline{37,490}\\
\hspace{20pt}\textbf{Net Income}&\underline{\underline{\textbf{\$}\hspace{6pt}\textbf{6,210}}}\\
\end{array}$$

Now, let us prepare the pro forma balance sheet:
 
$$\textbf{Pro Forma}\\
\textbf{Balance Sheet}$$

$$\begin{array}{l r l r}
\text{Assets}&{\$31,395}&\text{Debt}&{\$7,705}\\
{}&{}&\text{Equity}&\underline{23,690}\\
\hspace{20pt}\textbf{Total }&\underline{\underline{\textbf{\$}\hspace{6pt}\textbf{31,395}}}&\hspace{20pt}\textbf{Total }&\underline{\underline{\textbf{\$}\hspace{6pt}\textbf{31,395}}}\\
\end{array}$$

## Plug
\
After the determination of the projected sales forecast and the estimation of the capital spending, there might be a surplus in the projected assets over the liabilities and equity. Consequently, the balance sheet amounts will not be balanced. 
\
A financial plug will be necessary since a new financing option will be used to finance the plans. A financial plug variable, simply a **plug**, served as a source for the external financing necessary to cover the shortages or surplus in the financing that will consequently balance out the amounts in the balance sheet.
The difference may be paid out by the company through cash dividends. **The cash dividend amount is considered the plug variable. Therefore, the amount of the plug liability is \$3,120.**
